CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT / PC71BM |
| spirobifluorene-based polymers |
| BHJ PSCs |

Explanation:

1. PSFDTBT / PC71BM: This is a blend of two polymers, PSFDTBT and PC71BM, which are used as the active layer in the polymer solar cells.
2. spirobifluorene-based polymers: This is a category of polymers that includes PSFDTBT, and it is the class of material used in the solar cells reported in the paragraph.
3. BHJ PSCs: This stands for Bulk Heterojunction Polymer Solar Cells, which is the type of solar cell technology used in the study.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT / PC71BM (polymer blend) |
| spirobifluorene-based polymers |

Explanation:

1. PSFDTBT / PC71BM (polymer blend): This is a specific blend of two polymers, PSFDTBT and PC71BM, which are used as the active layer in the polymer solar cells. It is the material that was used in the study reported in the paragraph.
2. spirobifluorene-based polymers: This is a category of polymers that includes PSFDTBT, and it is the class of material used in the solar cells reported in the paragraph.

Note: I removed "BHJ PSCs" as it refers to a type of solar cell technology, not a specific material.

Paragraph: Without using any additive and any post-treatment , polymer solar cells based on PSFDTBT / PC71BM demonstrated a PCE of 4.6% with a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based polymers applied in BHJ PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value          |
|-----------------------|
| PCE (Performance Efficiency Coefficient) of PSFDTBT / PC71BM polymer solar cells |
| Value: 4.6%           |
| Open-circuit voltage of PSFDTBT / PC71BM polymer solar cells |
| Value: 0.94 V         |

|-----------------------|

| Value: 0.94 V         |

Note: In this case, all entities in the paragraph refer to material properties of the PSFDTBT / PC71BM polymer solar cells, so all entities are valid. However, if there were entities that did not clearly refer to material properties, they would have been removed.
